Title: Great chicken breasts
Review:
Great chicken breasts, great product created by nature, but Foster Farms company messed up this wonderful product by adding way too much salt to this product. Why? It's impossible to consume/eat those chicken breasts if you simply defrost them in the air - too much salt. It Is also impossible to drink chicken bouillon in which these chicken breasts were cooked - bullion is way over salted, so it has to go to the garbage every time. There is ~300mg of sodium on 4oz of chicken breasts. The only one way to bring those chicken breasts to normal condition is to soak them in the water for a long time to wash the salt out, before cooking. Why are you adding so much salt? Can't find a logical explanation. Or maybe you just want to cause harm to people, because too much salt causes the following health issues: high blood pressure, risk of developing osteoporosis, kidney problems, risk of stomach cancer, worsening heart health. I'm sure that Foster Farms company is aware of that, so why are you messing up this wonderful product consciously and on purpose by adding way too much salt?

I had purchased dandelion root in the past from Mountain Rose Herbs and had in the past was very happy with my previous orders. This organic dandelion root powder was nothing like what I had purchased in the past.  After using the organic dandelion root powder for two weeks  realizing that the organic dandelion root powder was doing nothing for me nor were any of the other herb powders that I had purchased in this order.  I looked at the picture of the organic dandelion powder on their website which was a light beige color but what they sent me was a dark roasted color...The organic dandelion that MRH had sent me in the past was a light beige herb powder not dark roasted. When I confronted MRH and told them their was a problem with their herb powders, they responded that they don't always update the picture of the current herb powders on their website and due to the steam pasteurization process that can change the color of the powders. Their poor quality control measures really concerned me. I called two outstanding herb companies and they informed me that they also use the steam pasteurization process on their herbs but this process does not and will not change the color of herbs. MRH gave me permission and sent me a label to return the complete order and they only gave me credit for half my order. I am no longer a MRH customer. MRH is not the company they used to be.   I have purchase organic dandelion root powder from Frontier and have been very happy and satisfied.. You learn the hard way what company has good quality... Who wants to pay for a bad product?
